entities.name: auntie muriel
entities.description: Auntie Muriel is mentioned as the one who is criticizing Doge's obituary. She says that he 'skated over the sticky patches' and that she knows he worshipped Dumbledore.

entities.name: doge
entities.description: Doge is mentioned as the one who wrote the obituary of Dumbledore. He defends himself saying that he was writing from the heart.

entities.name: dumbledore
entities.description: Dumbledore is mentioned as a person who has passed away and is being remembered by Doge in his obituary.

entities.name: harry
entities.description: Harry is mentioned as the one who is present at the scene and is reacting to Auntie Muriel's statement about Dumbledore.

relationships.description: Auntie Muriel criticizes Doge for his obituary of Dumbledore.
Doge wrote an obituary for Dumbledore.
Auntie Muriel informs Harry about a statement she made about Dumbledore.
